## Digital lexica


Liddell and Scott's *Greek Lexicon* must rank among the nineteenth century's greatest contributions to infrastructure for the study of the Greco-Roman world. Even after its 1940 revision and expansion by Henry Stuart Jones (hence the usual abbreviation *LSJ*), the contents of the lexicon remain largely unchanged. Readers of *LSJ* have to allow for the assumptions of Victorian Englishmen and navigate their sometimes unfamiliar language, *LSJ*'s organization of articles in a historical development of senses, supported by abundant citations of illustrative examples,
